bwwExcerpt: Arden, who delivered a brilliant new musical with “Maybe Happy Ending” last season, drops the ball by juggling too many. The sub-Zoom call live videos as the documentary filmmakers shoot, an intellectually lazy 1661 frame story at the French court of Louis XVI and Marie Antoinette that should’ve gotten the guillotine in early development and unappealing staging on a drab construction site all come to naught.

keyPhrases.quote: drops the ball by juggling too many
should've gotten the guillotine in early development

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: The critic harshly criticizes multiple fundamental elements of the production - the concept, staging, and story structure - with vivid negative metaphors and concludes everything fails completely. | GPT-4o-mini: The review is overwhelmingly negative, criticizing the script and staging without any redeeming qualities mentioned.
